Griffith Library

Library Workshops

Griffith University Library makes open source shareable lessons available to researchers. If you are enrolled at Griffith, you may also be able enrol in a counterpart workshop conducted live, in-person or online!

Book an in-person workshop

This call to action card is a great place to showcase some important information or display a clever tagline!

Digital skills

Digital Tools for Research

Become familiar with a wide range of digital tools available to assist you throughout your research journey.

Go to course

Digital dexterity

Self-assessment tool to learn more about your level of digital dexterity.

Go to course

Collecting, cleaning and managing research data

Systematic reviews

Learn ways to effectively build a robust search strategy for your systematic-style review.

Go to course

Research data management

Create a data management plan for your research, including materials classification, practising responsible research and good data storage habits.

Go to course

Intro to data wrangling

Get acquainted with OpenRefine, an open source tool to explore, clean, organise, combine and transform data.

Go to course

Advanced data wrangling

Go further with OpenRefine, including combining datasets, geolocating data, and "what if" exploration.

Go to course

Intro to text mining

Understand the what, how and why of building, cleaning, analysing and visualising a text corpus from the web.

Go to course

Intro to LimeSurvey

Get started with this flexible and user-friendly research survey tool.

Go to course

Intro to REDCap

Get up and running with this data collection tool oriented at clinical and longitudinal research.

Go to course

Visualisation

Data visualisation basics

Learn fundamental concepts relating to presenting your research data in an attactive and understandable way.

Go to course

Data storytelling

Your research data needs to tell a story. Understand the steps involved in taking your research from raw data to a compelling narrative.

Go to course

Legal research

Finding cases

An introductory course on legal research using LexisNexis and Westlaw case citators.

Go to course

Finding legislation

An introductory course on finding current, amended or repealed Queensland and Commonwealth statutes.

Go to course

Copyright

Copyright and publishing

Considerations under Australian copyright law for academic researchers. Covers articles, theses, books, images, web data and more.

Go to course
